intro: Whitia oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed whitia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Whitia oblongifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
